member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionExtension
T:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Accordion

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.active
member.summary: Selector for the active element. Set to false to display none at start. Needs collapsible: true. Default: first child Types: Selector, Element, jQuery, Boolean, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.animated
member.summary: Choose your favorite animation, or disable them (set to false). In addition to the default, 'bounceslide' and all defined easing methods are supported ('bounceslide' requires UI Effects Core). Default: 'slide' Types: Boolean, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.autoHeight
member.summary: If set, the highest content part is used as height reference for all other parts. Provides more consistent animations. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.clearStyle
member.summary: If set, clears height and overflow styles after finishing animations. This enables accordions to work with dynamic content. Won't work together with autoHeight. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.collapsible
member.summary: Whether all the sections can be closed at once. Allows collapsing the active section by the triggering event (click is the default). Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.event
member.summary: The event on which to trigger the accordion. Default: 'click'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.fillSpace
member.summary: If set, the accordion completely fills the height of the parent element. Overrides autoheight. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.header
member.summary: Selector for the header element. Default: '> li > :first-child,> :not(li):even' Types: Selector, jQuery

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.icons
member.summary: Icons to use for headers. Icons may be specified for 'header' and 'headerSelected', and we recommend using the icons native to the jQuery UI CSS Framework manipulated by jQuery UI ThemeRoller Default: { 'header': 'ui-icon-triangle-1-e', 'headerSelected': 'ui-icon-triangle-1-s' }

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.navigation
member.summary: If set, looks for the anchor that matches location.href and activates it. Great for href-based state-saving. Use navigationFilter to implement your own matcher. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.navigationFilter
member.summary: Overwrite the default location.href-matching with your own matcher. Default:

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.change
P:SharpKit.jQuery.AccordionOptions.changestart
T:SharpKit.jQuery.AddClassExtension
member.summary: [edit]addClass( class, [duration] ) Adds the specified class to each of the set of matched elements with an optional transition between the states.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ButtonOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Button

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Datepicker is a highly configurable plugin that adds datepicker functionality to your pages. You can customize the date format and language, restrict the selectable date ranges and add in buttons and other navigation options easily. By default, the datepicker calendar opens in a small overlay onFocus and closes automatically onBlur or when a date if selected. For an inline calendar, simply attach the datepicker to a div or span. You can use keyboard shortcuts to drive the datepicker: page up/down - previous/next month ctrl+page up/down - previous/next year ctrl+home - current month or open when closed ctrl+left/right - previous/next day ctrl+up/down - previous/next week enter - accept the selected date ctrl+end - close and erase the date escape - close the datepicker without selection [edit]Utility functions $.datepicker.setDefaults( settings ) - Set settings for all datepicker instances. $.datepicker.formatDate( format, date, settings ) - Format a date into a string value with a specified format. $.datepicker.iso8601Week( date ) - Determine the week of the year for a given date: 1 to 53. $.datepicker.parseDate( format, value, settings ) - Extract a date from a string value with a specified format.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Datepicker

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.altField
member.summary: The jQuery selector for another field that is to be updated with the selected date from the datepicker. Use the altFormat setting below to change the format of the date within this field. Leave as blank for no alternate field. Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.altFormat
member.summary: The dateFormat to be used for the altField option. This allows one date format to be shown to the user for selection purposes, while a different format is actually sent behind the scenes. For a full list of the possible formats see the formatDate function Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.appendText
member.summary: The text to display after each date field, e.g. to show the required format. Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.buttonImage
member.summary: The URL for the popup button image. If set, button text becomes the alt value and is not directly displayed. Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.buttonImageOnly
member.summary: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.buttonText
member.summary: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with showOn equal to 'button' or 'both'. Default: '...'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.changeMonth
member.summary: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.changeYear
member.summary: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.closeText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the showButtonPanel to display this button. Default: 'Done'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.constrainInput
member.summary: True if the input field is constrained to the current date format. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.currentText
member.summary: The text to display for the current day link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Use the showButtonPanel to display this button. Default: 'Today'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.dateFormat
member.summary: The format for parsed and displayed dates. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. For a full list of the possible formats see the formatDate function. Default: 'mm/dd/yy'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.dayNames
member.summary: The list of long day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the dateFormat setting. They also appear as popup hints when hovering over the corresponding column headings. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: ['Sunday', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday']

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.dayNamesMin
member.summary: The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: ['Su', 'Mo', 'Tu', 'We', 'Th', 'Fr', 'Sa']

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.dayNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the dateFormat setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat']

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.defaultDate
member.summary: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank. Specify either an actual date via a Date object, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +7d'), or null for today. Default: null Types: Date, Number, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.duration
member.summary: Control the speed at which the datepicker appears, it may be a time in milliseconds, a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast"), or '' for immediately. Default: 'normal' Types: String, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.firstDay
member.summary: Set the first day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, ... This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.gotoCurrent
member.summary: If true, the current day link moves to the currently selected date instead of today. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.hideIfNoPrevNext
member.summary: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable (see minDate/maxDate). You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.isRTL
member.summary: True if the current language is drawn from right to left. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.maxDate
member.summary: Set a maximum selectable date via a Date object, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +1w'), or null for no limit. Default: null Types: Date, Number, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.minDate
member.summary: Set a minimum selectable date via a Date object, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '-1y -1m'), or null for no limit. Default: null Types: Date, Number, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.monthNames
member.summary: The list of full month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the dateFormat setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: ['January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June', 'July', 'August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December']

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.monthNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated month names, for use as requested via the dateFormat setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. Default: ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec']

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.navigationAsDateFormat
member.summary: When true the formatDate function is applied to the prevText, nextText, and currentText values before display, allowing them to display the target month names for example. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.nextText
member.summary: The text to display for the next month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon. Default: 'Next'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.numberOfMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to show at once. The value can be a straight integer, or can be a two-element array to define the number of rows and columns to display. Default: 1 Types: Number, Array

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.prevText
member.summary: The text to display for the previous month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon. Default: 'Prev'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.shortYearCutoff
member.summary: Set the cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with dateFormat 'y'). If a numeric value (0-99) is provided then this value is used directly. If a string value is provided then it is converted to a number and added to the current year. Once the cutoff year is calculated, any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to it are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century. Default: '+10' Types: String, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showAnim
member.summary: Set the name of the animation used to show/hide the datepicker. Use 'show' (the default), 'slideDown', 'fadeIn', or any of the show/hide jQuery UI effects. Default: 'show'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to show the button panel. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showCurrentAtPos
member.summary: Specify where in a multi-month display the current month shows, starting from 0 at the top/left. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showMonthAfterYear
member.summary: Whether to show the month after the year in the header. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showOn
member.summary: Have the datepicker appear automatically when the field receives focus ('focus'), appear only when a button is clicked ('button'), or appear when either event takes place ('both'). Default: 'focus'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showOptions
member.summary: If using one of the jQuery UI effects for showAnim, you can provide additional settings for that animation via this option. Default: {}

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.showOtherMonths
member.summary: Display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.stepMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to move when clicking the Previous/Next links. Default: 1

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.yearRange
member.summary: Control the range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to current year (-nn:+nn) or absolute (nnnn:nnnn). Default: '-10:+10'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.beforeShow
member.summary: Can be a function that takes an input field and current datepicker instance and returns an options object to update the datepicker with. It is called just before the datepicker is displayed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.beforeShowDay
member.summary: The function takes a date as a parameter and must return an array with [0] equal to true/false indicating whether or not this date is selectable, [1] equal to a CSS class name(s) or '' for the default presentation and [2] an optional popup tooltip for this date. It is called for each day in the datepicker before is it displayed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.onChangeMonthYear
member.summary: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker moves to a new month and/or year. The function receives the selected year, month (1-12), and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field. Default: null Types: function(year, month, inst)

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.onClose
member.summary: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is closed, whether or not a date is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field. Default: null Types: function(dateText, inst)

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DatepickerOptions.onSelect
member.summary: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters. this refers to the associated input field. Default: null Types: function(dateText, inst)

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogExtension
member.summary: A dialog is a floating window that contains a title bar and a content area. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon by default. If the content length exceeds the maximum height, a scrollbar will automatically appear. A bottom button bar and semi-transparent modal overlay layer are common options that can be added. A call to $(foo).dialog() initializes a dialog. If you want a click to open a dialog, use $(foo).dialog('open'), but if the dialog hasn't been destroyed, the $(foo).dialog() init call is only required once, not on each click.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Dialog

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.autoOpen
member.summary: When autoOpen is true the dialog will open automatically when dialog is called. If false it will stay hidden until .dialog("open") is called on it. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.bgiframe
member.summary: When true, the bgiframe plugin will be used, to fix the issue in IE6 where select boxes show on top of other elements, regardless of zIndex. Requires including the bgiframe plugin. Future versions may not require a separate plugin. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.buttons
member.summary: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. The property key is the text of the button. The value is the callback function for when the button is clicked. The context of the callback is the dialog element; if you need access to the button, it is available as the target of the event object. Default: { }

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.closeOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies whether the dialog should close when it has focus and the user presses the esacpe (ESC) key. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.dialogClass
member.summary: The specified class name(s) will be added to the dialog, for additional theming. Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.draggable
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will be draggable will be draggable by the titlebar. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.height
member.summary: The height of the dialog, in pixels. Default: 'auto'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.hide
member.summary: The effect to be used when the dialog is closed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.maxHeight
member.summary: The maximum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.maxWidth
member.summary: The maximum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.minHeight
member.summary: The minimum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels. Default: 150

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.minWidth
member.summary: The minimum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels. Default: 150

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.modal
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will have modal behavior; other items on the page will be disabled (i.e. cannot be interacted with). Modal dialogs create an overlay below the dialog but above other page elements. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.position
member.summary: Specifies where the dialog should be displayed. Possible values: 'center', 'left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom', or an array containing a coordinate pair (in pixel offset from top left of viewport) or the possible string values (e.g. ['right','top'] for top right corner). Default: 'center' Types: String, Array

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.resizable
member.summary: If set to true, the dialog will be resizeable. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.show
member.summary: The effect to be used when the dialog is opened. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.stack
member.summary: Specifies whether the dialog will stack on top of other dialogs. This will cause the dialog to move to the front of other dialogs when it gains focus. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.title
member.summary: Specifies the title of the dialog. The title can also be specified by the title attribute on the dialog source element. Default: ''

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.width
member.summary: The width of the dialog, in pixels. Default: 300

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.zIndex
member.summary: The starting z-index for the dialog. Default: 1000

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.beforeclose
member.summary: This event is triggered when a dialog attempts to close. If the beforeclose event handler (callback function) returns false, the close will be prevented. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.open
member.summary: This event is triggered when dialog is opened. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.focus
member.summary: This event is triggered when the dialog gains focus. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.dragStart
member.summary: This event is triggered at the beginning of the dialog being dragged. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.drag
member.summary: This event is triggered when the dialog is dragged. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.dragStop
member.summary: This event is triggered after the dialog has been dragged. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.resizeStart
member.summary: This event is triggered at the beginning of the dialog being resized. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.resize
member.summary: This event is triggered when the dialog is resized. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.resizeStop
member.summary: This event is triggered after the dialog has been resized. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DialogOptions.close
member.summary: This event is triggered when the dialog is closed. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Draggable plugin makes selected elements draggable by mouse. Draggable elements gets a class of ui-draggable. During drag the element also gets a class of ui-draggable-dragging. If you want not just drag, but drag-and-drop, see the jQuery UI Droppable plugin, which provides a drop target for draggables. All callbacks (start, stop, drag) receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object, view below for a documentation of this object (if you name your second argument 'ui'): ui.helper - the jQuery object representing the helper that's being dragged ui.position - current position of the helper as { top, left } object, relative to the offset element ui.offset - current absolute position of the helper as { top, left } object, relative to page

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Draggable

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.addClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-draggable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .draggable() init on many hundreds of elements. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.appendTo
member.summary: The element passed to or selected by the appendTo option will be used as the draggable helper's container during dragging. By default, the helper is appended to the same container as the draggable. Default: 'parent' Types: Element, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.axis
member.summary: Constrains dragging to either the horizontal (x) or vertical (y) axis. Possible values: 'x', 'y'. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.cancel
member.summary: Prevents dragging from starting on specified elements. Default: ':input,option'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.connectToSortable
member.summary: Allows the draggable to be dropped onto the specified sortables. If this option is used (helper must be set to 'clone' in order to work flawlessly), a draggable can be dropped onto a sortable list and then becomes part of it. Note: Specifying this option as an array of selectors has been removed. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.containment
member.summary: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element or region. Possible string values: 'parent', 'document', 'window', [x1, y1, x2, y2]. Default: false Types: Selector, Element, String, Array

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.cursor
member.summary: The css cursor during the drag operation. Default: 'auto'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.cursorAt
member.summary: Moves the dragging helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds after mousedown until dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.distance
member.summary: Distance in pixels after mousedown the mouse must move before dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element. Default: 1

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.grid
member.summary: Snaps the dragging helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y] Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.handle
member.summary: If specified, restricts drag start click to the specified element(s). Default: false Types: Element, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. Possible values: 'original', 'clone', Function. If a function is specified, it must return a DOMElement. Default: 'original' Types: String, Function

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.iframeFix
member.summary: Prevent iframes from capturing the mousemove events during a drag. Useful in combination with cursorAt, or in any case, if the mouse cursor is not over the helper. If set to true, transparent overlays will be placed over all iframes on the page. If a selector is supplied, the matched iframes will have an overlay placed over them. Default: false Types: Boolean, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the helper while being dragged. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.refreshPositions
member.summary: If set to true, all droppable positions are calculated on every mousemove. Caution: This solves issues on highly dynamic pages, but dramatically decreases performance. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.revert
member.summary: If set to true, the element will return to its start position when dragging stops. Possible string values: 'valid', 'invalid'. If set to invalid, revert will only occur if the draggable has not been dropped on a droppable. For valid, it's the other way around. Default: false Types: Boolean, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.revertDuration
member.summary: The duration of the revert animation, in milliseconds. Ignored if revert is false. Default: 500

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted by the droppable. Default: 'default'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.scroll
member.summary: If set to true, container auto-scrolls while dragging. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.scrollSensitivity
member.summary: Distance in pixels from the edge of the viewport after which the viewport should scroll. Distance is relative to pointer, not the draggable. Default: 20

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.scrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance. Default: 20

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.snap
member.summary: If set to a selector or to true (equivalent to '.ui-draggable'), the draggable will snap to the edges of the selected elements when near an edge of the element. Default: false Types: Boolean, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.snapMode
member.summary: Determines which edges of snap elements the draggable will snap to. Ignored if snap is false. Possible values: 'inner', 'outer', 'both' Default: 'both'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.snapTolerance
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the snap element edges at which snapping should occur. Ignored if snap is false. Default: 20

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.stack
member.summary: Controls the z-Index of the defined group (key 'group' in the hash, accepts jQuery selector) automatically, always brings to front the dragged item. Very useful in things like window managers. Optionally, a 'min' key can be set, so the zIndex cannot go below that value. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.zIndex
member.summary: z-index for the helper while being dragged. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.start
member.summary: This event is triggered when dragging starts. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.drag
member.summary: This event is triggered when the mouse is moved during the dragging. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DraggableOptions.stop
member.summary: This event is triggered when dragging stops. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableExtension
T:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Droppable

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.accept
member.summary: All draggables that match the selector will be accepted. If a function is specified, the function will be called for each draggable on the page (passed as the first argument to the function), to provide a custom filter. The function should return true if the draggable should be accepted. Default: '*' Types: Selector, Function

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.activeClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being dragged. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.addClasses
member.summary: If set to false, will prevent the ui-droppable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .droppable() init on many hundreds of elements. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.greedy
member.summary: If true, will prevent event propagation on nested droppables. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.hoverClass
member.summary: If specified, the class will be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being hovered. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.scope
member.summary: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted. Default: 'default'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.tolerance
member.summary: Specifies which mode to use for testing whether a draggable is 'over' a droppable. Possible values: 'fit', 'intersect', 'pointer', 'touch'. fit: draggable overlaps the droppable entirely intersect: draggable overlaps the droppable at least 50% pointer: mouse pointer overlaps the droppable touch: draggable overlaps the droppable any amount Default: 'intersect'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.activate
member.summary: This event is triggered any time an accepted draggable starts dragging. This can be useful if you want to make the droppable 'light up' when it can be dropped on. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.deactivate
member.summary: This event is triggered any time an accepted draggable stops dragging. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.over
member.summary: This event is triggered as an accepted draggable is dragged 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.out
member.summary: This event is triggered when an accepted draggable is dragged out (within the tolerance of) this droppable. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.DroppableOptions.drop
member.summary: This event is triggered when an accepted draggable is dropped 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable. In the callback, $(this) represents the droppable the draggable is dropped on. ui.draggable represents the draggable. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.EffectExtension
member.summary: [edit]effect( effect, [options], [speed], [callback] ) Uses a specific effect on an element (without the show/hide logic).

member.name: M:SharpKit.jQuery.EffectExtension.effect(SharpKit.jQuery.jQuery,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,SharpKit.jQuery.jQueryUIEvent)
member.summary: Uses a specific effect on an element (without the show/hide logic).
member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.
A object/hash including specific options for the effect.
A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).
A function that is called after the effect is completed.

member.name: M:SharpKit.jQuery.EffectExtension.effect(SharpKit.jQuery.jQuery,System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Uses a specific effect on an element (without the show/hide logic).
member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.
A object/hash including specific options for the effect.
A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).

member.summary: Uses a specific effect on an element (without the show/hide logic).
member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.
A object/hash including specific options for the effect.

member.name: M:SharpKit.jQuery.EffectExtension.effect(SharpKit.jQuery.jQuery,System.String)
member.summary: Uses a specific effect on an element (without the show/hide logic).
member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.

member.name: M:SharpKit.jQuery.EffectExtension.effect(SharpKit.jQuery.jQuery,SharpKit.jQuery.EffectType,System.Object,System.Object,SharpKit.jQuery.jQueryUIEvent)

member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.
A object/hash including specific options for the effect.
A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).
A function that is called after the effect is completed.

A object/hash including specific options for the effect.
A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000).

member.param: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'bounce', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'highlight', 'puff', 'pulsate', 'scale', 'shake', 'size', 'slide', 'transfer'.
A object/hash including specific options for the effect.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.HideExtension
member.summary: [edit]hide( effect, [options], [speed], [callback] ) The enhanced hide method optionally accepts jQuery UI advanced effects. Uses a specific effect on an element to hide the element if the first argument is an effect string.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.HideOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Hide

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.HideOptions.effect
member.summary: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'puff', 'slide', 'scale', 'size', 'pulsate'. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.HideOptions.options
member.summary: A object/hash including specific options for the effect. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.HideOptions.speed
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.HideOptions.callback
member.summary: A function that is called after the effect is completed. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ProgressbarExtension
member.summary: The progress bar is designed to simply display the current % complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside it's parent container by default. This is a determinate progress bar, meaning that it should only be used in situations where the system can accurately update the current status complete. A determinate progress bar should never fill from left to right, then loop back to empty for a single process -- if the actual percent complete status cannot be calculated, an indeterminate progress bar (coming soon) or spinner animation is a better way to provide user feedback.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ProgressbarOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Progressbar

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ProgressbarOptions.value
member.summary: The value of the progressbar. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ProgressbarOptions.change
member.summary: This event is triggered when the value of the progressbar changes. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.RemoveClassExtension
member.summary: [edit]removeClass( [class], [duration] ) Removes all or specified class from each of the set of matched elements with an optional transition between the states.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.RemoveClassOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for RemoveClass

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.RemoveClassOptions.class
member.summary: CSS classes to remove from the elements. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.RemoveClassOptions.duration
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Resizable plugin makes selected elements resizable (meaning they have draggable resize handles). You can specify one or more handles as well as min and max width and height. All callbacks (start,stop,resize) receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object. The ui object has the following fields: ui.helper - a jQuery object containing the helper element ui.originalPosition - {top, left} before resizing started ui.originalSize - {width, height} before resizing started ui.position - {top, left} current position ui.size - {width, height} current size

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Resizable

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.alsoResize
member.summary: Resize these elements synchronous when resizing. Default: false Types: Selector, jQuery, Element

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.animate
member.summary: Animates to the final size after resizing. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.animateDuration
member.summary: Duration time for animating, in milliseconds. Other possible values: 'slow', 'normal', 'fast'. Default: 'slow' Types: Integer, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.animateEasing
member.summary: Easing effect for animating. Default: 'swing'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.aspectRatio
member.summary: If set to true, resizing is constrained by the original aspect ratio. Otherwise a custom aspect ratio can be specified, such as 9 / 16, or 0.5. Default: false Types: Boolean, Float

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.autoHide
member.summary: If set to true, automatically hides the handles except when the mouse hovers over the element. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.cancel
member.summary: Prevents resizing if you start on elements matching the selector. Default: ':input,option'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.containment
member.summary: Constrains resizing to within the bounds of the specified element. Possible values: 'parent', 'document', a DOMElement, or a Selector. Default: false Types: String, Element, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.delay
member.summary: Tolerance, in milliseconds, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond duration. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when resizing should start. If specified, resizing will not start until after mouse is moved beyond distance. This can help prevent unintended resizing when clicking on an element. Default: 1

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.ghost
member.summary: If set to true, a semi-transparent helper element is shown for resizing. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.grid
member.summary: Snaps the resizing element to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y] Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.handles
member.summary: If specified as a string, should be a comma-split list of any of the following: 'n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw, all'. The necessary handles will be auto-generated by the plugin. If specified as an object, the following keys are supported: { n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw }. The value of any specified should be a jQuery selector matching the child element of the resizable to use as that handle. If the handle is not a child of the resizable, you can pass in the DOMElement or a valid jQuery object directly. Default: 'e, s, se' Types: String, Object

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.helper
member.summary: This is the css class that will be added to a proxy element to outline the resize during the drag of the resize handle. Once the resize is complete, the original element is sized. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.maxHeight
member.summary: This is the maximum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.maxWidth
member.summary: This is the maximum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.minHeight
member.summary: This is the minimum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to. Default: 10

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.minWidth
member.summary: This is the minimum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to. Default: 10

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.start
member.summary: This event is triggered at the start of a resize operation. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.resize
member.summary: This event is triggered during the resize, on the drag of the resize handler. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ResizableOptions.stop
member.summary: This event is triggered at the end of a resize operation. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Selectable plugin allows for elements to be selected by dragging a box (sometimes called a lasso) with the mouse over the elements. Also, elements can be selected by click or drag while holding the Ctrl/Meta key, allowing for multiple (non-contiguous) selections.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Selectable

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.autoRefresh
member.summary: This determines whether to refresh (recalculate) the position and size of each selectee at the beginning of each select operation. If you have many many items, you may want to set this to false and call the refresh method manually. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.cancel
member.summary: Prevents selecting if you start on elements matching the selector. Default: ':input,option'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the selecting should start. It helps preventing unwanted selections when clicking on an element. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when selecting should start. If specified, selecting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.filter
member.summary: The matching child elements will be made selectees (able to be selected). Default: '*'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.tolerance
member.summary: Possible values: 'touch', 'fit'. fit: draggable overlaps the droppable entirely touch: draggable overlaps the droppable any amount Default: 'touch'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.selected
member.summary: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation, on each element added to the selection. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.selecting
member.summary: This event is triggered during the select operation, on each element added to the selection. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.start
member.summary: This event is triggered at the beginning of the select operation. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.stop
member.summary: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.unselected
member.summary: This event is triggered at the end of the select operation, on each element removed from the selection. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SelectableOptions.unselecting
member.summary: This event is triggered during the select operation, on each element removed from the selection. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowExtension
member.summary: [edit]show( effect, [options], [speed], [callback] ) The enhanced show method optionally accepts jQuery UI advanced effects. Uses a specific effect on an element to show the element if the first argument is a effect string.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Show

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowOptions.effect
member.summary: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'puff', 'slide', 'scale', 'size', 'pulsate'. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowOptions.options
member.summary: A object/hash including specific options for the effect. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowOptions.speed
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ShowOptions.callback
member.summary: A function that is called after the effect is completed. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Slider plugin makes selected elements into sliders. There are various options such as multiple handles, and ranges. The handle can be moved with the mouse or the arrow keys. All callbacks receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object, view below for a documentation of this object (if you name your second argument 'ui'): ui.handle: DOMElement - the current focused handle ui.value: Integer - the current handle's value

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Slider

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.animate
member.summary: Whether to slide handle smoothly when user click outside handle on the bar. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.max
member.summary: The maximum value of the slider. Default: 100

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.min
member.summary: The minimum value of the slider. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.orientation
member.summary: Normally you don't need to set this option because the plugin detects the slider orientation automatically. If the orientation is not correctly detected you can set this option to 'horizontal' or 'vertical'. Default: 'auto'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.range
member.summary: If set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a stylable range element between these two. Two other possible values are 'min' and 'max'. A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max. Default: false Types: Boolean, String

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.step
member.summary: Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) needs to be evenly divisible by the step. Default: 1

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.value
member.summary: Determines the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.values
member.summary: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If range is set to true, the length of 'values' should be 2. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.start
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user starts sliding. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.slide
member.summary: This event is triggered on every mouse move during slide. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(..).slider('value', index) to get another handles' value. Return false in order to prevent a slide, based on ui.value. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.change
member.summary: This event is triggered on slide stop, or if the value is changed programmatically (by the value method). Takes arguments event and ui. Use event.orginalEvent to detect whether the value changed by mouse, keyboard, or programmatically. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(this).slider('values', index) to get another handle's value. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SliderOptions.stop
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stops sliding. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableExtension
member.summary: The jQuery UI Sortable plugin makes selected elements sortable by dragging with the mouse. All callbacks receive two arguments: The original browser event and a prepared ui object, view below for a documentation of this object (if you name your second argument 'ui'): ui.helper - the current helper element (most often a clone of the item) ui.position - current position of the helper ui.offset - current absolute position of the helper ui.item - the current dragged element ui.placeholder - the placeholder (if you defined one) ui.sender - the sortable where the item comes from (only exists if you move from one connected list to another)

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Sortable

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.appendTo
member.summary: Defines where the helper that moves with the mouse is being appended to during the drag (for example, to resolve overlap/zIndex issues). Default: 'parent'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.axis
member.summary: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically. Possible values:'x', 'y'. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.cancel
member.summary: Prevents sorting if you start on elements matching the selector. Default: ':input,button'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.connectWith
member.summary: Takes a jQuery selector with items that also have sortables applied. If used, the sortable is now connected to the other one-way, so you can drag from this sortable to the other. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.containment
member.summary: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element - can be a DOM element, 'parent', 'document', 'window', or a jQuery selector. Default: false Types: Element, String, Selector

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.cursor
member.summary: Defines the cursor that is being shown while sorting. Default: 'auto'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.cursorAt
member.summary: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the sorting should start. It helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when sorting should start. If specified, sorting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Can be used to allow for clicks on elements within a handle. Default: 1

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.dropOnEmpty
member.summary: If empty allows for an item to be dropped from a linked selectable. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.forceHelperSize
member.summary: If true, forces the helper to have a size. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.forcePlaceholderSize
member.summary: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.grid
member.summary: Snaps the sorting element or helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [x, y] Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.handle
member.summary: Restricts sort start click to the specified element. Default: false Types: Selector, Element

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.helper
member.summary: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. The supplied function receives the event and the element being sorted, and should return a DOMElement to be used as a custom proxy helper. Possible values: 'original', 'clone' Default: 'original' Types: String, Function

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.items
member.summary: Specifies which items inside the element should be sortable. Default: '> *'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.opacity
member.summary: Defines the opacity of the helper while sorting. From 0.01 to 1 Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.placeholder
member.summary: Class that gets applied to the otherwise white space. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.revert
member.summary: If set to true, the item will be reverted to its new DOM position with a smooth animation. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.scroll
member.summary: If set to true, the page scrolls when coming to an edge. Default: true

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.scrollSensitivity
member.summary: Defines how near the mouse must be to an edge to start scrolling. Default: 20

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.scrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance. Default: 20

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.tolerance
member.summary: This is the way the reordering behaves during drag. Possible values: 'intersect', 'pointer'. In some setups, 'pointer' is more natural. intersect: draggable overlaps the droppable at least 50% pointer: mouse pointer overlaps the droppable Default: 'intersect'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Z-index for element/helper while being sorted. Default: 1000

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.start
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting starts. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.sort
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.change
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting, but only when the DOM position has changed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.beforeStop
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting stops, but when the placeholder/helper is still available. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.stop
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting has stopped. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.update
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stopped sorting and the DOM position has changed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.receive
member.summary: This event is triggered when a connected sortable list has received an item from another list. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.remove
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item has been dragged out from the list and into another. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.over
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved into a connected list. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.out
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved away from a connected list. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.activate
member.summary: This event is triggered when using connected lists, every connected list on drag start receives it. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SortableOptions.deactivate
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting was stopped, is propagated to all possible connected lists. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SwitchClassExtension
member.summary: [edit]switchClass( remove, add, [duration] ) Switches from the class defined in the first argument to the class defined as second argument, using an optional transition.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.SwitchClassOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for SwitchClass

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SwitchClassOptions.remove
member.summary: The CSS class that will be removed. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SwitchClassOptions.add
member.summary: The CSS class that will be added. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.SwitchClassOptions.duration
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsExtension
T:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Tabs

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.ajaxOptions
member.summary: Additional Ajax options to consider when loading tab content (see $.ajax). Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.cache
member.summary: Whether or not to cache remote tabs content, e.g. load only once or with every click. Cached content is being lazy loaded, e.g once and only once for the first click. Note that to prevent the actual Ajax requests from being cached by the browser you need to provide an extra cache: false flag to ajaxOptions. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.collapsible
member.summary: Set to true to allow an already selected tab to become unselected again upon reselection. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.cookie
member.summary: Store the latest selected tab in a cookie. The cookie is then used to determine the initially selected tab if the selected option is not defined. Requires cookie plugin. The object needs to have key/value pairs of the form the cookie plugin expects as options. Available options (example): { expires: 7, path: '/', domain: 'jquery.com', secure: true }. Since jQuery UI 1.7 it is also possible to define the cookie name being used via name property. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.deselectable
member.summary: deprecated in jQuery UI 1.7, use collapsible. Default: false

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.disabled
member.summary: An array containing the position of the tabs (zero-based index) that should be disabled on initialization. Default: []

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.event
member.summary: The type of event to be used for selecting a tab. Default: 'click'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.fx
member.summary: Enable animations for hiding and showing tab panels. The duration option can be a string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast") or the duration in milliseconds to run an animation (default is "normal"). Default: null Types: Options, Array<Options>

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.idPrefix
member.summary: If the remote tab, its anchor element that is, has no title attribute to generate an id from, an id/fragment identifier is created from this prefix and a unique id returned by $.data(el), for example "ui-tabs-54". Default: 'ui-tabs-'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.panelTemplate
member.summary:
HTML template from which a new tab panel is created in case of adding a tab with the add method or when creating a panel for a remote tab on the fly. Default: '
'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.selected
member.summary: Zero-based index of the tab to be selected on initialization. To set all tabs to unselected pass -1 as value. Default: 0

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.spinner
member.summary: The HTML content of this string is shown in a tab title while remote content is loading. Pass in empty string to deactivate that behavior. Default: 'Loading…'

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.TabsOptions.tabTemplate
member.summary:
HTML template from which a new tab is created and added. The placeholders #{href} and #{label} are replaced with the url and tab label that are passed as arguments to the add method. Default: '
#{label}'

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleExtension
member.summary: [edit]toggle( effect, [options], [speed], [callback] ) The enhanced toggle method optionally accepts jQuery UI advanced effects. Uses a specific effect on an element to toggle the element if the first argument is an effect string.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for Toggle

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleOptions.effect
member.summary: The effect to be used. Possible values: 'blind', 'clip', 'drop', 'explode', 'fold', 'puff', 'slide', 'scale', 'size', 'pulsate'. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleOptions.options
member.summary: A object/hash including specific options for the effect. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleOptions.speed
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleOptions.callback
member.summary: A function that is called after the effect is completed. Default: null

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleClassExtension
member.summary: [edit]toggleClass( class, [duration] ) Adds the specified class if it is not present, and removes the specified class if it is present, using an optional transition.

member.name: T:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleClassOptions
member.summary: Options JSON object for ToggleClass

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleClassOptions.class
member.summary: A CSS class to toggle on the elements. Default: null

member.name: P:SharpKit.jQuery.ToggleClassOptions.duration
member.summary: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000). Default: null Types: String, Number

member.name: T:AssemblyDoc
member.summary: SharpKit interface for jQuery UI. jQuery UI provides abstractions for low-level interaction and animation, advanced effects and high-level, themeable widgets, built on top of the jQuery JavaScript Library, that you can use to build highly interactive web applications.
